resources.string: Enabled apply on boot for %s section
Disabled apply on boot for %s section
Failed to apply settings on boot
Tap on an individual command to choose between copying it or deleting it from the database.
Tap this card to copy or delete all saved startup settings
Are you sure you want to delete all Start-up Commands?
Core: %d - Frequencies Used For Less Than 1
Set the maximum frequency the CPU Cores scales up to.
Set the minimum frequency the CPU Cores scales down to.
Set the maximum frequency the CPU scales up to when the screen is off.
The CPU governor determines how the CPU behaves in response to changes in workload. Changing the governor will impact how the CPU scales through the frequency steps available to your CPU.
Click to change the various configuration items which are Governor-dependent.
Schedule work-queues on awake CPUs to save power.
Policy decides the CFS scheduler how to balance tasks onto different CPU unit.
CPUQuiet implements pluggable policies for forcing Cores into quiescent state. Appropriate policies will save power without hurting performance.
Allows you to activate debug mask for CPU Boost operations.
Minimum interval a CPU is boosted.
When CPU loading crosses the preset threshold, the current CPU is raised to this frequency.
Minimum interval a CPU is boosted when input is detected.
CPU frequency to be boosted to this frequency upon input detection.
Wakeup Boost is similar to input boost but it occurs when screen is turned on.
Hotplug Boost is similar to input boost but it occurs when CPUs go online.
Enable to set individual frequency for it Core.\nDisabling this will set all Cores frequency to Core 0 current Max/Min frequencies.
Enable to set individual governor for it Core.\nDisabling this will set all Cores Governor to Core 0 current Governor setting.
Click to change the various configuration items which are Governor-dependent for Core %d.
Choose maximum frequency that Core %d scale up to.
Choose minimum frequency that Core %d scale down to.

Unable to set requested Max frequency for core %s.\nThe thermal-driver can set the Max frequency lower then the one you are trying to use, on that situation you need to wait the device cool down, when it cool down the Max frequency will be restore automatic
Unable to set requested Min frequency to core %s, try again.
Unable to set requested Min frequency to core %d, requested frequency equal or biger them current Max frequency for this core.
Unable to set requested Max frequency to core %d, requested frequency equal or lower them current Min frequency for this core.
Unable to set requested Governor to core %s, try again.
Disable to remove manufacturer limits on undervolting
Default Voltages not saved, using current voltages as reference. Please reboot for accurate reference values.
Values in parenthesis show your change from the reference values.
Warning: This Hotplug has no enable or disable toggle. Be aware that having more than one hotplug enabled can cause erratic behavior.
Qualcomm\'s hotplugging solution. You might get problems with changing frequencies when this is enabled.
An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s MPDecision. Developed by faux123.
The number in the parentheses indicates the amount of cores online at any time.
This will boost your minimum CPU speed if you touch the screen or press a button.
Enables aggressive thread migration to big cores for high performance, consumes more power.
The lower it is, the faster response.
Allows you to activate debug mask for this operations.
Maximum number of CPUs boosted at the same time.
Minimum number of CPUs that will be always online.
Maximum number of CPUs that will be always online.
Maximum number of cores online when screen is off.
Minimum interval a CPU is boosted.
Minimum interval a CPU is kept online.
An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s MPDecision. Developed by Stratos Karafotis.
An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s MPDecision. Developed by Will Tisdale (Thalamus).
Load at which an extra CPU is put online.
Load at which all CPUs are enabled.
Load at which a CPU is taken offline.
Sampling rate in milliseconds, converted to jiffies at runtime.
An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s MPDecision. Developed by Code_Blue team.
Sets 1 CPU maximum online with frequency @1728 MHz.
Over this threshold the driver will put one more core online.
An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s MPDecision. Developed by myfluxi.
Number of samples taken in consideration for average load across CPUs. Lower means quicker/more erratic.
Interval between taking samples of load across CPUs. Lower means quicker/more erratic.
Improve latencies by instantly putting online all CPUs if current load on any CPU is above a certain threshold.
Sets the minimum frequency the CPU scales down to when fast lane reaches the above load.
Don\'t offline a CPU if it drops under the lower levels up threshold load.
Used to make the hotplug consider the I/O time as CPU load time.
An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s MPDecision. Developed by franciscofranco.
Number of CPUs online when touching screen or pressing button.
The threshold to online all CPUs.
The threshold to online all CPUs.
An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s MPDecision. Developed by show-p1984.
Use only one core when screen is off.
If the first core is below this frequency, then don\'t plug the other cores.
Time until Hotplug starts to work.
If something else plugs in the CPU, fall asleep for this amount of time.
An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s MPDecision. Developed by Alucard.
How often the governor should poll for CPU usage in terms of frequency and load percentage to make hotplugging decisions.
Number of samples to evaluate core %d hotplug
Number of samples to evaluate core %d hotunplug
The CPU load at which governor hotplug core %d. Value corresponding to 101 causes immediately hotplug
The CPU load at which governor hotunplug core %d. Value corresponding to 101 causes immediately hotunplug
Threshold run queue length for hotplug core %d
Threshold run queue length for hotunplug core %d
Up threshold frequency for hotplug core %d, if current frequency greater than or equal to selected frequency hotplug this core. Higher value corresponds to delay in hotplug.
Down threshold frequency for hotunplug core %d, if current frequency less than selected frequency hotunplug this core. Lower value corresponds to delay in hotunplug.
An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s MPDecision. Developed by varunchitre15.
Minimum number of cores online when screen is off.
An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s MPDecision. Developed by bbedward.
How long to wait before turning on any cores.
Don\'t turn on any cores when charge is below the selected capacity.
An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s MPDecision. Developed by mrg666.
Cycles to wait after the last hotplug event to unplug another core.
Cycles to wait after the last hotplug event to plug another core.
An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s MPDecision. Based on IntelliPlug by faux123. Developed by arter97.
Limits the number of possible cores
Amount of time threshold needs to be exceeded before online-ing a core
Amount of time threshold needs to be below before offline-ing a core
If this threshold is reached, CPU%d will be hotplugged.
If this threshold is reached, CPU%d will be unplugged.
This amount of time must have passed for CPU%d to be hotplugged.
This amount of time must have passed for CPU%d to be unplugged.
Maximum number of CPUs onlined while screen on.
Maximum number of CPUs onlined while screen off.
Economical level core limiting. Limits max cpus online at this battery percentage.
Max CPUs online after reaching Economical Battery level
Max CPUs online after reaching Critical Battery level
Enable to allow the driver to unplug/hotplug cores and see the Dynamic extra tunables.
Dynamic hotplugging will Online cores if average load is greater than up threashold
Dynamic hotplugging will offline cores if average load is less than down threashold
Time (ms) Interval to check for Load Average VS Up/Down Threashold.
Lord Boefflas solution for keeping big cores alive
Maximum cores to be allowed online.
Hotplug Driver ported from HTC m9

Using stock kernel the recommendation is to not change a thing in here.

On custom Kernel:

When using Intellithermal be aware too high value for (Frequency Throttle Temperature) can be danger!

Only one thermal driver can be enable, the app will auto switch one off if the other is on and vice versa.
Stock Qualcomm thermal kernel driver that prevents device from overheating. This should be disabled if the device has an default alternative.
An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s Thermald. Developed by faux123.\nEnable to see the tunables
An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s Thermald. Developed by faux123 and alucard_24.
Allows you to activate debug mask for thermal operations.
Temperature to start shutting down cores.\n(Default 80째C - 176째F)
Polling time to check if temperature need to be change.\n(Default 250ms)
An in-kernel replacement for Qualcomm\'s Thermald. Developed by show-p1984.
Not even show-p1984 would dare turn it off.
This allows to debug the CPUs throttle when the temperature reaches maximum.
The thermal will use this frequency to throttle the maximum temperature.
If the temperature goes above, the thermal will throttle the CPU frequency to lower the temperature.
An system binary thermald, this thermald have no user control.
Only one thermal drive can be enable\nEnable one disable the other\nand vice versa
This can cause over heat and permanently damaged to the device
Set the maximum frequency the RAM scales up to.
Set the minimum frequency the RAM scales down to.
Polling time to check if frequencie need to be change.\n(Default 50ms)
Set the maximum 2D frequency the GPU scales up to.
Set the maximum frequency the GPU scales up to.
Set the minimum frequency the GPU scales down to.
Set the 2D governor of the GPU.
Set the governor of the GPU.

Not all but some GPU_GOV have tunables, if the below is empty this GOV doesn't have it.

Governos that have Tunable:
msm-adreno-tz
simple_ondemand

In some featuring is need to enable the first switch under tunables to see others controllers for that.
An add-on for MSM Adreno TZ GPU Governor. Developed by faux123.
This increases the threshold to ramp up or down GPU frequencies. The lower it is, the more performance you get.
This increases the number of times the GPU governor ramp down requests. The higher it is, the more performance you get.
An efficient workaround for msm-adreno-tz\'s overheads.
Threshold for determining if the workload of the GPU is idle.

Number of events to wait before ramping down the frequency. The idlewait\'th events before current one must be all idle before Adreno idler ramps down the frequency. This implementation is to prevent micro-lags on scrolling or playing games. Adreno idler will more actively try to ramp down the frequency if this is set to a lower value.
Adreno idler will more actively try to ramp down the frequency if this is set to a higher value.
Gaming Mode restricts the GPU to the maximum power level while enabled.
Bound GPU to only use the MIN or the MAX frequency (all the middle will not be used).
Threshold for determining if the workload of the GPU is idle.
Threshold for determining if the workload of the GPU is high.
You might get problems with MSM8x26 SoC when setting a high value.
After selecting a profile, please turn your screen off and on.
Get more profiles from the Internet.
Use exponential back-light mode instead of linear mode.
Allows you to decrease the LCD screen brightness lower than it\'s possible on stock.
Allows you to increase the LCD screen brightness higher than it\'s possible on stock.
Enable inverting the screen colors by quickly pressing MENU button 4 times.

Register intercept acts like a hook and will enable catching scenario settings and modifying them through delta controls. If a scenario does not have a setting (register) in its base sequence, then it cannot be modified by the hook.
Enabling the master sequence will disable and ignore Samsung\'s profiles and scenarios, the ROM controls will be disabled.
Enabling this will let you use your phone even while wearing gloves.
This value is specific to wake gestures and independent of the normal vibration strength. It is purely for the kernel driver. Gestures controlled by third party apps will not use this value.
Wake up your device by double tapping the screen.
Wake up your device by swiping on the screen to the selected direction:
Only require 1st and 4th button to trigger Sweep2Wake.
Wake up your device by tapping the screen.
Sweep across the bottom of the screen to sleep.
Lock your device by double tapping on the top of the screen.
Launch default camera by drawing a circle on the screen.\nThis circle is not easy to make right + S2W when enabled can make this featuring harder to use.
Enabling this will turn off wake controls when device in pocket.
Set a duration when the wake controls will be disabled after the screen goes off.
Enabling this will turn off wake controls when the screen is turned off by the power key.
Used to control the time that a sweep has to occur within to register as a sweep event
Used to control the time that touches have to occur within to register as a DT2W event
Used to control the allowed distance between tap #1 and tap #2 along the Horizontal axis. This may help with unintentional wakes quite a bit
Used to control the allowed distance between tap #1 and tap #2 along the Vertical axis. This may help with unintentional wakes quite a bit
This helps prevent distortion at higher volumes.
Run software workaround to avoid leakage on the speaker drive
Charge current very weak.\nProbably defective charger and/or cable.
Device will charge faster when connected with USB. Replug your charger when changing this option.
Set a limit for the capacity to which the battery will be charged by passing a value between 0 and 100.
Set Custom Battery Charge Rate. Caution: Exceeding 1250mA may damage your charging driver.
Set the active I/O elevator algorithm. The Scheduler decides how to handle I/O requests.
The various configuration items which are Scheduler-dependent.
The Read-ahead value on the phone memory.
Maintain I/O statistics for this storage device. Disabling will break I/O monitoring applications.
Try to have scheduler requests complete on the Core they were made from.
Reduces memory usage but has an impact on the CPU usage.
Prevents KSM activities when the CPU is at sleep, reduces some CPU usage in return for less memory savings.
Max CPU percentage for UKSM to use when merging pages
This parameter controls the behavior of LMK when VM pressure is in the range of 90–94 (is a pseudo minfree value, higher than the highest configured value in minfree LMK values)
Make LMK more aggressive dynamically when a thrashing scenario is detected.

Click on one of the Profile below to set its values to LMK Min Free parameters.

Values will be set according this order:
A,B,C,D,E,F,G
Were:
A = Foreground Applications
B = Visible Applications
C = Secondary Server
D = Hidden Applications
E = Content Provider
F = Empty Applications
G = VM Pressure Min

*G VM Pressure Min, only available in BHB27 Kernel
Anon pages of inactive tasks can be reclaimed, depending on memory pressure. Memory pressure is detected using VM pressure events.
The max number of pages tried to be reclaimed in a single run.

Scheduling process reclaim work-queue unnecessarily when the reclaim efficiency is low does not make sense. We try to detect a drop in efficiency and disable reclaim for a time period. This period and the period for which we monitor a drop in efficiency is defined by (Time Period VS Optimal Efficiency)
Optimal efficiency values used as threshold by (Time Period)
Max Vm pressure value where process reclaim operates
Min Vm pressure value where process reclaim operates
Change Z-RAM size is a process that takes a few seconds and it may fail if Z-RAM is busy, so if after a change you don\'t see the result after a few seconds (3 to 5) try again after a minute or two

Attempts to increase performance by avoiding paging on physical storage, instead using a compressed virtual device in RAM. Paging takes place in RAM until it is necessary to use the swap space on physical storage.
Size LZO smaller then LZ4\nPerformance LZ4 faster then LZO

Contains, as a percentage of total system memory, the number of pages at which a process which is generating disk writes will itself start writing out dirty data. Lower the amount of unwritten write cache to reduce lags when a huge write is required.
Contains, as a percentage of total system memory, the number of pages at which the pdflush background writeback daemon will start writing out dirty data.

This tunable is used to define when dirty data is old enough to be eligible for writeout by the kernel flusher threads. It is expressed in 100\'ths of a second. Data which has been dirty in-memory for longer than this interval will be written out next time a flusher thread wakes up.

The kernel flusher threads will periodically wake up and write old data out to disk. This tunable expresses the interval between those wakeups, in 100\'ths of a second. Setting this to zero disables periodic writeback altogether.
This feature allows to have two different intervals for dirty page writebacks and to dynamically manage them when the system has been resumed (it\'s active) or when has been suspended.

The kernel flusher threads will periodically wake up and write old data out to disk. This tunable expresses the interval between those wakeups during suspend, in 100\'ths of a second. Setting this to zero disables periodic writeback altogether.

The kernel flusher threads will periodically wake up and write old data out to disk. This tunable expresses the interval between those wakeups while active, in 100\'ths of a second. Setting this to zero disables periodic writeback altogether.
Percentage of physical memory size to include in overcommit calculations.

Controls the tendency of the kernel to move processes out of physical memory and onto the swap disk. Because disks are much slower than RAM, this can lead to slower response times for system and applications if processes are too aggressively moved out of memory.
Controls the tendency of the kernel to reclaim the memory which is used for caching of directory and inode objects.
This option will delay the writebacks of file system bits cached in RAM while screen is ON (Enable for better performance at a slight risk of possible data loss if crashed or sudden loss of power).

This is used to force the Linux VM to keep a minimum number of kilobytes free. The VM uses this number to compute a pages_min value for each lowmem zone in the system. Each lowmem zone gets a number of reserved free pages based proportionally on its size.
This parameter tells the VM to keep extra free memory between the threshold where background reclaim (kswapd) kicks in, and the threshold where direct reclaim (by allocating processes) kicks in.

Read:
Wake up devices blocking to write to the entropy pool (i.e. sources which will use the aforementioned ioctl to add entropy to the pool) when the pool gets low. It will not necessarily have the effect of adding entropy.

Write:
Is opposite, this is the number of bits of entropy required to be Available before entropy allow anything to read from /dev/random. /dev/urandom ignores this parameter (since reads from it are nonblocking and don't wait for entropy, instead allowing pseudorandom data to be read).
Disable android logging can save some power, but in the case of a problem there will be no logs to check, let it enabled to debug a problem.
The maximum frequency value the BCL driver will mitigate the CPU\'s.
The battery voltage threshold above which the BCL driver clears the previously applied mitigation, disables the battery current monitoring, and starts monitoring for low battery voltage.
The battery voltage threshold below which the BCL driver starts monitoring the battery current thresholds and mitigates the CPU on the event of high load.
Choose how many core will be unplugged when the BCL driver starts to mitigate the CPU

When enable allow to charge the device if the battery is in the \"Cold\" health state. This is only recommended for devices that have a malfunctioning battery temperature sensor that always show \"Cold\" as the state
CRC is a mechanism aiming to prevent data corruption when enabled. Data blocks can lose up to 30 % of their performance.
Disable for better file system performance at the risk of data loss in case of a system crash.
When enabled and screen is on, fsync operation is asynchronous. When screen is off, this operation is done synchronously.
Only give sleepers 50 % of their service deficit. Disabling this can save a little battery power.
Kernel Mode, LCD Hooks and Highest Level Hook are automatically managed by the kernel. To manually enable or disable the Power Suspend State choose User Mode.
A new state notifier driver by Neobuddy89.\n\nDesign to improve communication between drivers and suspend/resume routine.

Enable to see tunable.
Toggle between State and FB Notifiers.

Currently: State Notifier

Enable to see tunable.
Toggle between State and FB Notifiers.

Currently: FB Notifier
When suspended, prevents suspend routines wait X seconds to prevent false/very short suspend calls.(default 10sec)
Kernel power management driver when screen is off. Better battery savings if enabled. Note: You can only change this setting if Power Suspend Mode is in User Mode.
The Transmission Control Protocol is one of the Core protocols of the Internet protocol suite (IP), and is so common that the entire suite is often called TCP/IP.
Enable ADB over WiFi. Connect to:

Wakelock is a mechanism of power management service in Android OS, which can be used to keep CPU awake (Partial wakelock) and keep the screen on (Full wakelock).

Toggle on: Service can acquire a wakelock.
Toggle off: Service cannot acquire a wakelock.

Default state for all wakelocks is ON, disable a wakelock can have a reverse effect (over discharge of the battery) and is rare but can cause a random reboot, so re-enable in case of a problem.
Allow wakelock when power disconnected.\n Currently: %s
Allow wakelock when Ambient Display disabled.\n Currently: %s
Shows a list with the latest active wakelock and they total time duration
Is possible to click and copy\nActive time (hh:mm:ss) | Requests | Wakelock name:
Allows to disable one wakelock by it\'s name as a test\n Currently: %s
Forbidden space in the wakelock name!
Shallowest Sleep with instant wake up.
Slightly deeper sleep with slight latency when waking up. (Disable this if you encounter screen flickering)
Deeper sleep with longer latency when waking up.
Really deep sleep with longest latency when waking up.
Turn on green front LED when battery reaches 100%

A algorithm that uses past position and velocity of a touch event to predict touch position in the future, so that screen updates are made anticipating the future position, mitigating the inherent latency of the system, making the system more responsive.
A backup with the same name already exists. Delete it first!
Adding a new profile:\nSet a name, and select sections to be saved to this profile.\n*Don\'t select CPU Voltage if you plane to share this.

Profiles:
 Adding a profile will save your current settings to Internal Storage/KA_profiles/profiles.json. You can apply them later, and share with others.

Per App Settings:
 Enable a pre saved profile to automatic load the Kernel Adiutor settings based on the start of foreground app, it is saved on Internal Storage/KA_profiles/per_app.json.

Tip:
 1. If you plan to share a profile do not Select CPU Voltage when making a profile, as it device runs on a different voltage table.
 2. Do Not share Per app Profiles as it person have a different set of apps
You removed all sections! No profiles for you.
Select Apps that will activate this profile:
Do you want to run your actions? Your device will reboot into recovery and the actions will run in the order as you added them.
You have to add an action first.
If your device does not support Init.d you can enable Emulate Init.d. By enabling the Init.d Emulation the application will run the scripts after your device boots up, but before apply on boot.
Click to search in a log, the result can be copied or saved to a file
Write yours search (\' will be removed)
Some special characters are forbidden (\') they are automatic removed\nThe search is case insensitive
One click All Logs to a ZIP
Generates a .zip file with all individual logs to:\n/sdcard/KA_Logs/logs%s.zip
Copy last driver message (this log contains info from yours previously reboot or random reboot) to:\n/sdcard/KA_Logs/lastdmesg%s.txt

*Only display log result that did not output empty
The below text is scrollable and selectable you can copy and share.Tip: Copy a word and then re-run the search using that word or a characters combination

Search text:
Choose at least one type of log!
Zip generated but only with Driver message and Get prop!
Android logging is disable, Logcat, Radio Logs and Events Logs is empty!\n\nEnable Android logging in Misc and try again
Error!\n\nCan\'t create a Log folder in /sdcard/KA_Logs/ Check permission if the problem persist contact the developer
Copy current kernel saved changes (section with changes and apply on boot enable) to:\n/sdcard/KA_Logs/kernel_changes%s.txt
Show a notification when apply on boot service starts. Please disable this if you get any problems.
Test apply on boot (with delay). If nothing happens then there are no saved settings.
Hide its view when scrolling down.
You have to enable apply on boot at least for one section first.

You can protect Kernel Adiutor by setting up a password. Every time you open this application, you have to enter it. If you forget it, simply wipe the data of this application in settings of your device. Don\'t worry I won\'t share your password.
Show a toast when applying a profile for Per App detection
Enable to relocate Navigation Drawer to opposite side of the screen.
Kernel Adiutor is licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0, and uses following libraries
This application is open source. Check it out on my GitHub!
Do you want more features? or found a bug?\nClick here and mention @baybutcher27 with the request or bug on the XDA thread.
This app is supported via XDA thread check it here
This application is being heavily modified for the kernel BHB27-Kernel for Quark Motorola (Moto Maxx, Turbo or Droid Turbo). Check it out in the downloads section!
Service to monitor when foreground app changes for per-app profile loading
